abstract: David Li, the Hong Kong banker and lawmaker who is paying $8.1 million to settle a United States inquiry into his possible role in an insider-trading case involving shares of Dow Jones & Company, resigned from the city government’s executive council late Saturday.
lead_paragraph: David Li, the Hong Kong banker and lawmaker who is paying $8.1 million to settle a United States inquiry into his possible role in an insider-trading case involving shares of Dow Jones & Company, resigned from the city government’s executive council late Saturday.

headline.main: Ex-Dow Jones Director Leaves Hong Kong Post

abstract: It appears that Merrill Lynch is about to get another foreign investor, albeit one with a very small stake. South Korea’s Hana Bank has agreed to buy 1 million shares of Merrill Lynch from Temasek Holdings, Singapore’s state-owned investment company, for $50 million, according to Dow Jones.
lead_paragraph: It appears that Merrill Lynch is about to get another foreign investor, albeit one with a very small stake. South Korea’s Hana Bank has agreed to buy 1 million shares of Merrill Lynch from Temasek Holdings, Singapore’s state-owned investment company, for $50 million, according to Dow Jones.

headline.main: Singapore Said to Sell Part of Merrill Stake
